frame: There is meant to be a correct way to prefer women's body parts, and any deviation should be shameful.
rationale: The frame enforces a narrow, prescriptive standard of sexual preference and shames those who deviate, demonstrating a gendered double standard.

frame: Women who drink have no right to criticize drunk men.
rationale: The problem of double standards (6.5.2) arises as the meme implies women are hypocritical for condemning drunk men while drinking themselves.
The problem of ridicule (4.2) arises as the meme mocks and belittles women for their behavior, using sarcasm to degrade their dignity.

frame: It is hypocritical for women to demand equal rights while avoiding equal responsibilities.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame criticizes women for seeking the benefits of equality without bearing the corresponding duties, highlighting a gender‐based inconsistency in expectations.

frame: Women are expected to be virgins, even in contexts where this is unrealistic.
rationale: This frame enforces a gender-based double standard by imposing an expectation on women (virginity) that is not equally applied to men.

frame: Women should only make sandwiches and must not talk back to men.
rationale: The frame enforces the gender norm that women’s roles are limited to domestic service by dictating that they should only make sandwiches, reflecting patriarchal expectations (6.5 Enforced gender norms).
The frame applies a double standard by allowing men the freedom to speak while demanding that women remain silent, illustrating unequal treatment based on gender (6.5.2 Double standards).

frame: It is acceptable to compare real women to exaggerated and unrealistic depictions of female characters.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme implies it is fair to hold a live-action actress to the sexualized and physically impossible standards of a cartoon character.
The problem of sexualization arises as the meme highlights and celebrates the cartoon character’s exaggerated, hyper-sexualized body proportions as a benchmark for real women.

frame: Women and girls should be relegated to household chores while men and boys enjoy leisure activities.
rationale: The frame enforces a sexist double standard by depicting leisure as appropriate for male family members while female family members are confined to domestic work.
It reinforces traditional gender roles and implies that women’s activities are less important or valuable than men’s.

frame: Violence against women is expected to be treated less seriously than violence against men.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame asserts that society applies different levels of seriousness to acts of violence based solely on the victim’s gender, downplaying violence against women while elevating concerns when men are victims.

frame: Female video game characters are meant to be depicted in revealing outfits while male characters wear practical armor.
rationale: The frame enforces a gender-based double standard by asserting that women must be sexualized in costume design whereas men are portrayed functionally, evoking the problem of double standards.

frame: Women should be judged more harshly for the same sexual behaviors that men engage in.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame enforces unequal evaluation of sexual behavior, condemning women for actions that are deemed acceptable when performed by men.

frame: Women’s empowerment is only possible by giving them unfair advantages over men.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises because the frame suggests that women receive special treatment to succeed, implying unequal criteria compared to men.

The problem of minimizing feminist efforts arises as the frame mocks and trivializes initiatives aimed at promoting women’s empowerment, characterizing them as unfair handouts rather than legitimate measures for equality.

frame: Women should be judged more harshly than men for similar actions.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame asserts that women merit stricter moral judgment than men for identical behavior, perpetuating unequal expectations and criticism based on gender.

frame: Women should be judged more harshly than men for the same actions.
rationale: The frame enforces double standards by asserting that women ought to face stricter judgment than men for identical behavior, applying different rules based on gender.

frame: Women deserve to be labeled with derogatory terms for actions considered acceptable when performed by men.
rationale: The frame promotes derogatory labeling by encouraging the use of insulting terms toward women.
It also enforces double standards by suggesting that women’s actions merit contemptuous labels even when identical actions by men do not.

frame: Society should uphold double standards for women based on their body type.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises because the frame endorses judging women differently—praising some for their body size while criticizing others—thereby normalizing unequal treatment based on appearance.

frame: Men deserve heroic praise for helping with household chores.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame suggests that men’s assistance with household chores is extraordinary and worthy of special recognition, implying that women’s routine domestic labor is undervalued and taken for granted.

frame: It’s acceptable to pressure women to marry by a certain age because their worth declines if they remain unmarried past 30.
rationale: The frame enforces unequal social expectations by imposing age-based marital pressure on women that is not similarly applied to men, reinforcing a gendered double standard.

frame: Feminists are hypocritical because they cannot handle the same level of disrespect they give to men.
rationale: This frame distorts feminist principles by portraying feminists as hypocritical when they react to disrespect, reflecting the misunderstanding feminism problem (2.1.3).
By accusing feminists of failing the same standard they set, it invokes the double standards problem (6.5.2).

frame: A woman's worth and suitability as a wife depend solely on her sexual behavior.
rationale: The problem of sexual innuendo arises as the meme’s reference to a woman’s legs opening “faster than the Google homepage” uses indirect, humorous sexual suggestion to frame sexual activity as the primary criterion for marriage.
The problem of ridicule arises as the meme mocks and belittles a woman’s sexual behavior to undermine her dignity and suitability as “wife material.”
The problem of double standards arises as the meme shames women for sexual availability—implying it disqualifies them from marriage—while similar behavior from men is not stigmatized.

frame: Men are victims when they have sex on the first date, while women are blameworthy and deserve shame.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme applies opposite moral judgments to the same behavior: it positions men who initiate sex as innocent victims while condemning women for the identical action.

frame: Women are hypocritical and judgmental about men's physical attributes.
rationale: The problem of reverse sexism arises as the meme mocks men for their physical traits, applying a sexist standard toward males.
The problem of double standards arises as the meme suggests women hold men to stricter appearance norms than they apply to themselves.

frame: Men are more accepting and less critical of women's physical imperfections.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme implies men are expected to be lenient about women's looks, highlighting unequal expectations based on gender.

frame: Women who wrong men deserve to be harshly judged and labeled as losers.
rationale: The problem of derogatory labeling arises as the meme uses the term 'loser' to demean and insult women, applying a negative and contemptuous label to diminish their worth.

The problem of double standards arises as the meme implies that women are disproportionately and unfairly judged for mistakes in relationships, reinforcing patriarchal norms that hold women to stricter moral standards than men.

frame: Men deserve praise for their rational and mature conflict‐resolution skills, especially compared to women.
rationale: The frame applies different expectations to men and women by lauding men’s rationality while implicitly condemning women’s emotional reactions, creating a gender‐based double standard.
It contrasts men’s praised behavior with women’s belittled conduct, reinforcing unequal norms for each gender.

frame: It is acceptable to demean and dismiss women who give advice by calling them derogatory names.
rationale: The problem of derogatory labeling arises as the meme uses the term "whore" to demean and insult the female character, employing negative and contemptuous language.

The problem of double standards arises as the woman’s valid advice is ignored and met with a personal attack, demonstrating that women’s voices are dismissed through insult rather than engaged with seriously.

frame: Women should be considered more pleasant or rational when they are no longer in a relationship with a man.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises because the frame applies different judgments to women based solely on their relationship status, praising them as ‘better’ once single.
The problem of reductionism arises because the frame strips away women’s full personhood by defining their value and demeanor exclusively by whether they are in a relationship.

frame: Men are meant to be heroes, while women are meant to remain subordinate and show their worth only through domestic chores like ironing clothes.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme mocks the idea of a female counterpart to Iron Man by reducing “Iron Woman” to a household task, implying that men’s heroism is real while women’s is limited to domestic duties.

frame: Women should stay in the kitchen because they are not suited for more challenging tasks.
rationale: This frame imposes different expectations on women versus men by insisting women belong only in the kitchen while men take on demanding or dangerous roles, exemplifying a gender-based double standard.

frame: It is hypocritical to condemn men for hitting women while ignoring women who hit men.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame highlights that society applies different judgments to acts of violence depending on the gender of the perpetrator, condemning men for hitting women while overlooking women who hit men.

frame: Women should present themselves differently depending on their relationship with the person they are communicating with.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme implies women are expected to change their appearance and behavior inconsistently based on who they’re interacting with, enforcing unequal expectations.

frame: Women with multiple sexual partners deserve to be called sluts.
rationale: The problem of derogatory labeling arises as the frame uses the term “slut” to demean and insult women for their sexual behavior.
The problem of double standards arises as the frame implies that women are judged more harshly for their sexual behavior compared to men, reinforcing unequal expectations.

frame: It is acceptable to insult women based on their perceived sexual history.
rationale: The problem of derogatory labeling arises as the frame condones using negative, contemptuous terms to shame women for their sexual past.
The problem of double standards arises because the frame normalizes insulting women for sexual behavior that would not warrant the same treatment if exhibited by men.

frame: Men who want to avoid fighting can simply ‘become women,’ equating womanhood with cowardice.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme justifies exempting women from combat while mandating that men fight, and then ridicules the idea of ‘becoming a woman’ to escape duty, reinforcing unequal gendered expectations.

frame: Women’s cleavage is meant to be both criticized and approved by men.
rationale: The problem of sexual innuendo arises as the meme uses a pun about looking down on cleavage to draw attention to and sexualize women’s breasts for humor.
The problem of double standards arises as the frame highlights how men apply different judgments—approval or criticism—solely based on women’s physical attributes, reinforcing unequal expectations.

frame: Women should not work on cars; they should stay in the kitchen.
rationale: The meme enforces the sexist double standard that women belong in domestic roles (the kitchen) rather than technical fields like automotive repair.

frame: Men should financially provide for women, but women are not expected to support men in the same way.
rationale: This frame enforces a double standard by prescribing that men must bear financial responsibilities in relationships while women are exempt from reciprocal financial support.

frame: Women must remain eternally loyal to their deceased partners and are harshly judged if they seek new relationships.
rationale: This frame evokes the problem of double standards by implying that women alone are expected to wait indefinitely after a partner’s death, whereas men face no such expectation, thus enforcing unequal moral rules based on gender.

frame: Men should be blamed when women cheat.
rationale: The problem of victim blaming arises as the frame shifts responsibility for infidelity onto men, suggesting they are at fault when their partners cheat.
The problem of double standards arises as it implies that men must bear the consequences of a woman’s actions, whereas women are not similarly held accountable.

frame: Women who cheat and then expect an apology deserve to be insulted.
rationale: The problem of derogatory labeling arises as the frame employs contemptuous language to demean women who cheat, using insults to devalue them.
The problem of double standards arises as it enforces a harsher judgment on women’s infidelity than on men’s, reinforcing unequal standards of accountability.

frame: Women must conform to men's desires and make sacrifices, while men are not held to the same standards.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame implies that women are expected to make sacrifices and adhere to men's desires while men face no equivalent obligations.
The problem of sexual entitlement arises as the frame suggests men have the right to impose conditions on women’s behavior and expect sexual compliance as a default.

frame: Domestic chores and childcare are exclusively women's duties, and a wife is failing if her husband helps with them.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame applies different expectations to men and women: it demands that women alone handle domestic and childcare tasks while labeling them failures if men share those duties.

frame: Women deserve to be treated more leniently than men for the same offenses.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as this frame asserts that women should receive more lenient treatment than men for identical offenses, thereby applying different rules based on gender.

frame: Violence committed by women against men is not serious and can be joked about.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame trivializes violence when women are the perpetrators, applying a more lenient standard than would be applied if men committed the same acts and thereby minimizing its seriousness.

frame: Women only want equality when it benefits them.
rationale: This frame invokes the double standards problem by claiming women advocate for equal treatment selectively, applying one rule to themselves and another to men.
It also trivializes feminist efforts by suggesting that the goal of gender equality is self-serving rather than principled or universal, thereby downplaying the legitimacy of the movement.

frame: Women who have height preferences in men are superficial and unreasonable.
rationale: The problem of misrepresentation arises as the meme relies on a broad, oversimplified generalization about women’s dating preferences, portraying them as shallow and uniformly rejecting men below a certain height.

The problem of double standards arises as the meme criticizes women’s personal standards as hypocritical and unfair, implying they should not have preferences in men’s height while men routinely express preferences in women’s appearance.

frame: Women who dress provocatively are hypocritical for asking not to be sexualized.
rationale: The problem of sexualization arises as the meme reduces a woman’s value to her sexual appeal and implies that her clothing choices invite objectification.

The problem of double standards arises as the meme portrays it as hypocritical for women to reject sexualization while wearing provocative attire, applying different rules to women's behavior and respect.

frame: Men should always apologize to their female partners, regardless of the situation.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame demands that men uniquely bear the burden of apology, implying that women’s dissatisfaction is always justified and that men must conform to this unequal expectation.

frame: Men are not held to the same appearance standards as women.
rationale: This frame highlights and normalizes the unequal expectations between genders by suggesting that men can neglect grooming without social penalty, while women cannot.

frame: Women who oppose unrealistic body standards are hypocritical.
rationale: The problem of misunderstanding feminism arises as the meme distorts feminist protest by suggesting activists who oppose unrealistic body standards are hypocritically seeking sexual attention themselves, misrepresenting and dismissing the aims of the protest as mere hypocrisy.

The problem of double standards arises as the meme criticizes women for objecting to harmful beauty norms while they are actively fighting against those very norms, applying unequal expectations to women’s advocacy.

frame: A woman's career choices should be judged by how they affect her attractiveness.
rationale: The meme implies women’s professional decisions are valid only insofar as they preserve or enhance their looks, applying a gendered double standard that does not similarly constrain men.

frame: Women should conform to certain beauty standards to be considered attractive.
rationale: The problem of unrealistic beauty standards arises as the meme enforces oppressive and narrow ideals of physical appearance that women are expected to meet.
The problem of double standards arises as the meme applies a stricter aesthetic criterion to women—suggesting their worth and acceptance depend on adherence to prescribed beauty norms.

frame: It is acceptable to mock women for having unrealistic expectations of men.
rationale: The meme exaggerates and mocks the demands women supposedly have for men, implying it’s justified to criticize them for expecting qualities they themselves do not meet, reflecting a double standard.

frame: Women must shave their legs to be attractive and maintain a relationship.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme imposes a grooming requirement on women—leg shaving—to be deemed attractive and worthy of a relationship, a rule not equally applied to men.

frame: Women who don't shave are unattractive and resemble werewolves.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme applies a harsh and unfair attractiveness standard to women regarding body hair that is not expected of men.
The problem of ridicule arises as the meme uses demeaning language—likening unshaven women to ‘werewolves’—to mock and belittle their natural appearance.

frame: Women should only be concerned with domestic duties like cooking.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme enforces that women must handle cooking while men are not held to the same domestic expectations, applying unequal rules based solely on gender.

frame: Women are not capable or should not engage in tasks traditionally seen as men's work, such as fixing cars.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme permits men to perform mechanical tasks like fixing cars but prohibits women from doing the same, enforcing unequal gender roles.
The problem of undermining women’s capabilities arises as the meme implies women lack the skill or right to engage in ‘men’s work,’ devaluing their competence and autonomy.

frame: Feminists hypocritically condemn men for minor actions as abusive while excusing women’s violent behavior, unfairly targeting men.
rationale: The problem of misunderstanding feminism arises as the meme distorts feminist principles by portraying feminists as hypocritically excusing women’s violent behavior while harshly condemning trivial male actions, thus misrepresenting the movement’s goals.

The problem of double standards arises as the meme suggests that feminists apply one set of rules to men and another to women, unfairly blaming men for minor acts while ignoring comparable or worse acts by women.

frame: Women should do all the cooking and cleaning because that is their role.
rationale: The frame enforces a double standard by imposing household duties solely on women while exempting men from these responsibilities, reflecting different expectations based on gender.

frame: Women are hypocritical because they demand high standards from men but can't tolerate men's preferences.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme portrays women applying one set of expectations to men while refusing to accept men’s own preferences, highlighting an unfair inconsistency.
The problem of ridicule arises as the meme mocks women’s reactions, using sarcasm to belittle them and laugh at their perceived hypocrisy.

frame: Men’s sexual disclosures should be trusted more than women’s.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme posits that men are honest about their sexual habits while women are deceitful, applying unequal expectations and credibility based purely on gender.

frame: Older women should not be sexually active.
rationale: The problem of ageism arises as the meme depicts a doctor expressing disgust at an elderly woman’s sexual activity, reflecting prejudice and negative judgment based solely on her age.
The problem of double standards arises as the meme imposes stricter standards on older women’s sexual behavior compared to younger women or men, deeming their sexual activity inappropriate.

frame: Women deserve to be ridiculed for having inconsistent standards for sexual partners.
rationale: The problem of ridicule arises as the frame explicitly sanctions mocking women for their sexual choices, encouraging contemptuous laughter at them.
The problem of double standards arises as the frame highlights and condemns women’s supposed hypocrisy in applying different rules to men and to themselves, reinforcing unequal judgments.

frame: It is acceptable for men to cheat on their partner but not for women.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame applies one set of moral rules to men’s infidelity (permitted) and a stricter set to women’s infidelity (condemned), reinforcing gender inequity.

frame: Women who support gender equality are hypocritical.
rationale: The problem of misunderstanding feminism arises as the meme misrepresents feminist principles by labeling advocacy for equality as contradictory or hypocritical.
The problem of double standards arises as the meme applies different rules to men and women, criticizing women for expecting chivalrous treatment while they claim to support gender equality.

frame: If women have multiple partners, they should have no right to complain about infidelity.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme applies one rule to women (denying them the right to complain after having multiple partners) while not imposing the same rule on men.
This frame dismisses women’s legitimate feelings about betrayal by holding them to a stricter standard than men.

frame: Society ignores violence against men by women.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme suggests that society treats men and women differently when it comes to physical violence, ignoring female-perpetrated violence while condemning similar actions by men.

frame: Women's achievements are meant to be considered less valuable than men's achievements.
rationale: The frame applies different value judgments to awards based solely on gender, implying that winning an award as a woman is inherently less prestigious than winning the same award as a man.
By suggesting female achievements should be valued lower, the frame enforces a gendered hierarchy that privileges male accomplishments over female ones.

frame: Men should take the blame for their partners' infidelity and strive to be better.
rationale: This frame creates a double standard by suggesting that when a woman cheats, the man must apologize and ‘be a better man,’ whereas a man’s infidelity is dismissed with labels like ‘scum’ without the same expectation of self‐improvement.

frame: Women who speak out against objectification are hypocrites if they show their bodies.
rationale: The meme applies a contradictory rule by condemning women for both speaking against objectification and displaying their bodies, enforcing a double standard.
It dismisses women’s autonomy and experiences by implying they lose credibility when their personal choices (showing their bodies) conflict with their criticism of objectification.

frame: Women should perform household chores for men, while men face no similar responsibilities.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme enforces unequal expectations, assigning domestic duties solely to women while exempting men from the same responsibilities.

frame: Men deserve relaxation and comfort, while women should be attentive and serve their needs.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme implies that men are entitled to comfort whereas women must be subservient, holding each gender to different expectations.
The problem of enforced gender norms arises as the frame prescribes a rigid, traditional role for women—serving men’s needs—reinforcing patriarchal expectations.

frame: Men’s needs should always take priority over women’s health.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame grants men greater entitlement to care and support, while women’s health needs are devalued.
The problem of conditional respect arises as the frame only acknowledges a woman’s worth insofar as she serves a man’s needs, denying her equal consideration for her own wellbeing.

frame: It is acceptable for men to hit women if women hit first; violence between men and women should be treated equally, ignoring the potential for greater harm and societal implications.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme suggests that rules about violence are applied unequally based on gender, tolerating men’s violence when women ‘start it.’
The problem of trivializing women's issues arises as the meme normalizes reciprocal violence, minimizing the severity and disproportionate harm of violence against women.

frame: Feminists who criticize unrealistic depictions of women are hypocrites and deserve to be ridiculed because they aren’t conventionally attractive.
rationale: The problem of double standards is evoked because the frame accuses feminists of hypocrisy for criticizing media portrayals while not meeting traditional beauty standards themselves.
The problem of ridicule is evoked because the frame promotes mocking and belittling feminists based on their appearance.

frame: White girls should be mocked for drinking excessively.
rationale: The problem of ridicule arises as the meme uses humor to belittle and demean women for their drinking habits.
The problem of racism arises as the meme targets a specific racial group—white girls—perpetuating a stereotyped and disparaging portrayal based on race.
The problem of double standards arises as the meme implies that women’s behavior when drinking is especially notable and deserving of mockery, reinforcing unequal treatment compared to men.

frame: Women are manipulative and insincere when they flirt without intending a real relationship.
rationale: The problem of stereotyping arises as the meme portrays women as insincere and inconsistent in their interactions with men, generalizing their behavior.
The problem of double standards arises as the meme implies women apply different rules, flirting freely while refusing commitment, unfairly judging their motives.
The problem of commitment phobia arises as the meme mocks women for allegedly being unwilling to commit to a relationship despite initiating flirtatious behavior.

frame: Women have unrealistic expectations for men while not accepting criticism about their own appearance.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme highlights a perceived hypocrisy in standards of physical appearance and material success between men and women, suggesting women judge men but reject similar scrutiny themselves.

frame: Women are obliged to perform household chores such as laundry.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises because the frame enforces the unequal expectation that laundry and similar chores are exclusively a women's responsibility, judging them more harshly for failing to meet that norm.

frame: Men are meant to receive special recognition for being with women who are not conventionally attractive.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme praises men for a behaviour—being with an average-looking partner—that wouldn’t be singled out if the genders were reversed.
The problem of ridicule arises as the meme mocks the woman’s appearance indirectly by making the man’s ‘reward’ a joke, thereby demeaning her through humor.

frame: Women’s minimal interactions are meant to be interpreted as inappropriate behavior.
rationale: The frame enforces a double standard by prescribing that any small action by a woman be judged as improper, implying women are always at fault for how their behavior is perceived.

frame: Some men believe they are “nice guys” while holding and expressing misogynistic views.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the man presents himself as a benevolent 'nice guy' yet simultaneously holds and expresses sexist beliefs, applying one set of moral criteria to himself and another to women.

frame: Men are meant to be inherently better and more skilled than women.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme upholds a bias that men are skilled by default while women are judged against a different, lower standard.
The inconsistency is highlighted by labeling the male gamer a “pro” simply for being male, enforcing the notion that men deserve praise regardless of actual performance.

frame: Women are meant to be inexperienced and less competent than men.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme assigns women a lower baseline of competence, suggesting they naturally lack skill.
This is exemplified by branding the female gamer a “noob” purely on the basis of her gender, reinforcing unequal expectations for performance.

frame: Women deserve to be criticized for behaviors that are acceptable in men while still being expected to fulfill traditional feminine roles.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as this frame condemns women for actions (e.g., drinking) that are deemed acceptable in men, yet simultaneously demands they adhere to traditional feminine expectations, highlighting unequal treatment based on gender.

frame: Women who initiate social interactions are unfairly judged as pushy or unfeminine, and that judgment is justified.
rationale: The frame enforces a double standard by implying women must not take initiative in order to conform to traditional gender roles, legitimizing unfair criticism when they do.

frame: Women are hypocritical for being angry when men express preferences about sexual partners.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme portrays women as criticizing men’s sexual preferences while holding themselves free from similar scrutiny, implying a hypocrisy based on gendered expectations.

frame: Women's sports are not as important or serious as men's sports.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme applies unequal judgments by devaluing women’s athletic achievements and treating their sports as inherently less important or serious than men’s.

frame: In relationships, men should always be more reasonable and accountable than women.
rationale: The problem of ridicule arises as the meme derides women by contrasting them unfavorably with men, implying women are inherently less reasonable.
The problem of double standards arises as the frame sets an unequal expectation—holding women to a lower standard of accountability in relationships than men—thereby reinforcing gendered biases.

frame: Women should stick to traditional roles, like cooking.
rationale: This frame enforces a sexist double standard by prescribing that women must perform domestic tasks while other behaviors are not held to the same expectation for men.
It applies different rules to women’s behavior compared to men’s, praising cooking but implicitly disregarding men’s engagement in the same activities.

frame: Women who deviate from traditional roles are behaving poorly or adopting negative habits.
rationale: This frame labels women who engage in non-domestic behaviors as negative, reinforcing a double standard by condemning actions in women that are accepted or even praised in men.
It stereotypes and criticizes women for departing from prescribed gender roles, highlighting unequal expectations based on gender.

frame: Statutory rape by a female teacher should be viewed as less serious than when committed by a male teacher.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme suggests that identical criminal behavior (statutory rape) is treated differently based on the perpetrator’s gender, minimizing female-perpetrated abuse.

The problem of pedophilia exploitation arises as the meme normalizes and trivializes sexual activity between a teacher and a minor, depicting statutory rape by a woman as acceptable under certain conditions.

frame: Women who ask for equality but still expect traditional gender roles are hypocritical.
rationale: The problem of misunderstanding feminism arises as the frame portrays feminist demands as contradictory, mocking the movement’s goal of consistent equality by suggesting women can’t simultaneously seek equal rights and traditional courtesies.

The problem of double standards arises as the frame imposes unequal expectations on women’s behavior, criticizing them for wanting both equal treatment and chivalric gestures, which enforces inconsistent rules based on gender.

frame: Women deserve scorn for drug use, whereas men deserve admiration for the same behavior.
rationale: The frame implies a gendered hypocrisy by praising men’s heavy drug use while condemning women for identical behavior, reflecting a double standard in evaluating identical actions by different genders (6.5.2).

frame: Men are superior and should not engage in household chores, which are women’s responsibility.
rationale: The frame applies a different set of rules to men and women by exempting men from domestic duties, reinforcing unequal expectations based on gender.
It demeaningly elevates men above routine household tasks, perpetuating a patriarchal belief that women must perform all domestic labor.

frame: Women are hypocritical for expressing a desire not to be objectified while dressing in a certain way.
rationale: This frame evokes the problem of double standards by accusing women of inconsistency—criticizing objectification while choosing their own style—thereby dismissing women’s right to self-presentation and enforcing unequal expectations.
By labeling women as hypocrites, it creates an unfair rule that women must conform to male-defined norms about dress or remain silent about objectification.

frame: Married women should not dress or pose suggestively.
rationale: This frame applies different rules to married women than to others, enforcing stricter modesty—exemplifying a gendered double standard (6.5.2).
By focusing solely on a woman’s sexualized appearance and deeming it inappropriate, the frame reduces her to her sexuality (1.1 Sexualization).

frame: Men should feel ashamed of being financially supported by women, especially older women.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame enforces that only men – not women – should bear financial responsibility, giving rise to unequal gender expectations.

The problem of ageism arises as the frame specifically shames men for depending on older women, perpetuating negative judgments about older women's financial independence and reinforcing age-based bias.

frame: Women who refuse to date men living with their mothers but date married men deserve to be blamed for hypocrisy.
rationale: The problem of deflection is evoked because the frame shifts responsibility for dating challenges onto women, blaming them for supposedly inconsistent standards rather than examining broader social factors.

The problem of double standards is evoked because the frame applies one set of expectations to women’s choice of unwed partners and another to their choice of married partners, judging them unfairly based on gendered norms.

frame: Women who set high standards for men but do not meet those same standards themselves should be held to those expectations.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame criticizes women for applying stricter expectations to men that they themselves fail to satisfy, reinforcing unequal gender norms.

frame: Derogatory statements about women should be judged differently depending on who says them and the context.
rationale: This frame evokes the problem of double standards (6.5.2) by suggesting it is acceptable to use derogatory labels for women in some contexts or by certain speakers but not in others, reinforcing unequal treatment based on speaker identity and situation.

frame: Women are hypocritical when they insult others but refuse to tolerate insults themselves.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame accuses women of applying one set of rules to themselves and another to others, highlighting a perceived gendered inconsistency.
The problem of ridicule arises as the frame mocks women’s emotional responses, portraying them as unable to handle the same insults they dole out, thereby belittling their dignity.

frame: Women are judged and valued based on their sexual behavior and deemed morally inferior for engaging in sexual acts.
rationale: The problem of sexual innuendo arises as the caption uses a play on bending at the waist versus the knees to imply a sexual act, reducing women to their sexual behavior.
The problem of double standards arises as the frame imposes moral judgment on women for their sexual behavior, reflecting an unfair, gendered double standard.

frame: Women who engage in sexualized activities while advocating against objectification are hypocritical and deserve to be mocked.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme implies that women cannot advocate for strong female representation or criticize objectification while themselves participating in activities deemed sexualized, enforcing contradictory expectations.
The problem of ridicule arises as the meme mocks and shames women for this perceived hypocrisy, using humor to belittle their advocacy and sexuality.

frame: Women should be silent and not express their opinions.
rationale: The frame enforces a gendered rule that women must remain silent while men are allowed to speak freely, applying an unequal standard based solely on gender.

frame: Women only advocate for gender equality when it benefits them.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme suggests women support equality only when it serves their own interests, implying hypocritical gender norms (6.5.2).

The problem of misunderstanding feminism arises as the meme misrepresents feminist goals by reducing the call for equality to selfish motives, thereby distorting and dismissing the core principles of feminism (2.1.3).

frame: Women who take on traditionally masculine roles are not desirable partners.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme suggests that women are devalued for adopting roles considered appropriate for men, while men in traditionally feminine roles are not similarly criticized, reinforcing unequal expectations based on gender.

frame: Men should find it absurd to be asked to prepare dinner for their partners.
rationale: The frame enforces a double standard by implying that domestic duties like cooking are acceptable for women but ridiculous for men, applying different expectations based on gender.

frame: Mothers should maintain specific images depending on the social media platform they use.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme implies that mothers must conform to contradictory expectations—being the wholesome cook on Facebook and the hyper-sexualized stoner on Twitter—thereby applying different rules to the same group based on context.

frame: Women judge men’s bodies more harshly than men judge women’s bodies.
rationale: The problem of reductionism arises as the frame oversimplifies women’s attitudes by portraying them as uniformly superficial—caring only about penis size—thus reducing their identities to a narrow, negative trait.
The problem of double standards arises as the frame implies that women hold men to higher physical standards than men do women, creating unequal and unfair expectations based on gender.

frame: Men are entitled to side relationships and women must accept this submissively.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame asserts that men can have extramarital affairs without consequence while women are expected to tolerate and remain submissive, reflecting unequal rules based on gender.

frame: Domestic violence by women should not be considered as serious as domestic violence by men.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme applies unequal judgments to domestic violence based on the perpetrator’s gender, suggesting violence by women is less severe than the same violence by men.

frame: Women must adhere to certain behavioral standards or be judged harshly.
rationale: The problem of enforced gender norms arises as the frame demands strict, gendered rules for women’s conduct, limiting their freedom.
The problem of double standards arises as it implies that women alone will face harsh judgment for behavior deviations that men would not be punished for.

frame: Women must be confined to domestic duties, such as cooking, and serve men while they relax.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises because the meme enforces different expectations for men and women, assigning women exclusively to household labor while men are allowed leisure.
The problem of women subjugation arises as the meme depicts women as subordinate to men, valuing them only for their service and reinforcing patriarchal control.

frame: Overweight women are not meant to have standards or preferences in partners and deserve to be mocked for having any.
rationale: The problem of fat shaming arises as the meme mocks and ridicules the woman’s body size and weight, belittling her appearance.

The problem of double standards arises as the meme implies that overweight women should not have the same right as others to have standards in selecting partners, enforcing unequal expectations based on body size.

frame: Women want to have it both ways—equality when it suits them and traditional benefits when it suits them.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme portrays women as selectively demanding equality and traditional gender privileges based on convenience, unfairly characterizing them as inconsistent and opportunistic.

frame: Women who engage in physical affection outside of marriage are immoral.
rationale: The problem of derogatory labeling arises as the text uses moral condemnation (‘immoral’) to shame women for their private behavior.
The problem of double standards arises as the frame imposes harsh moral judgment only on women’s physical affection outside of marriage, while men are not held to the same standard.

frame: Women should not wear lace underwear because it is inappropriate.
rationale: The problem of ridicule arises as the meme mocks women’s choice of lace underwear by comparing it to decorative table doilies, belittling them for wearing it in a demeaning way.
The problem of policing women’s bodies arises as the meme criticizes and seeks to control women’s clothing choices, enforcing patriarchal norms about appropriate female attire.

The problem of double standards arises as the meme imposes traditional or conservative expectations on women’s fashion, judging them harshly for deviating from norms without applying similar scrutiny to men.

frame: Women who have height preferences in dating are overly demanding and deserve to be ridiculed.
rationale: The problem of ridicule arises as the meme mocks and belittles women’s dating preferences by treating them as absurd.
The problem of objectification arises as the meme compares women’s standards to burdensome ‘heavy objects,’ reducing their agency to a physical object.
The problem of double standards arises as the meme criticizes women for having specific preferences, while similar preferences in men are rarely mocked or challenged.

frame: Women’s role is to perform all the hard work while men can relax.
rationale: The frame enforces a double standard by implying that women must shoulder physical labor while men are exempt from responsibilities, reflecting sexist expectations about gender roles.

frame: Men are inherently superior and deserve praise even when they do nothing.
rationale: The frame upholds a double standard by suggesting that men merit admiration for minimal or no effort, devaluing women’s labor and reinforcing patriarchal male superiority.

frame: Women who let themselves go during quarantine deserve to be ridiculed.
rationale: The problem of ridicule arises as the frame explicitly calls for mocking women’s natural body hair and appearance when they fail to shave during quarantine.

The problem of double standards arises as the frame enforces the expectation that women must always maintain a certain level of grooming, even under extenuating circumstances like quarantine, a standard not equally applied to men.

frame: Women should be responsible for maintaining their partner’s attractiveness and are to blame when he declines in appearance.
rationale: The problem of scapegoating arises as the frame unfairly blames women for their husband’s or partner’s decline in appearance, attributing his natural aging or personal state solely to her actions.
The problem of double standards arises as the frame enforces a gendered expectation that women must uphold their partner’s looks—an unrealistic norm not equally imposed on men.

frame: Men must possess multiple positive attributes to be attractive.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme requires men to meet a variety of traits to be considered attractive, while imposing a much lower or singular standard on women.

frame: Women are complicated and require special treatment, whereas men are straightforward and normal.
rationale: The frame applies a different set of expectations to women by portraying them as difficult and in need of special handling compared to men, thereby reinforcing a double standard based on gender.

frame: Failing to treat women specially leads to negative consequences.
rationale: This frame threatens punishment or adverse outcomes if women are not accorded special treatment, enforcing unequal rules for women and perpetuating a gender-based double standard.

frame: A woman's worth is determined by her adherence to modesty standards.
rationale: This frame invokes double standards by asserting that women's value depends on conforming to restrictive modesty norms, a gendered expectation not equally applied to men.

frame: Women's demands for equality are hypocritical when they refuse to perform physical labor.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame criticizes women for advocating equal treatment while not engaging in the same physically demanding tasks expected of men.
The problem of gender essentialism arises as it assumes that physical labor is inherently male work and that women are naturally unsuited for it, reinforcing rigid gender roles.

frame: Providing special parking spaces for women is a condescending double standard.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme criticizes a privilege granted only to women—exclusive parking spots—thereby highlighting unequal treatment based on gender.

frame: A woman's worth or integrity is tied to her virginity.
rationale: The frame applies a different set of moral rules to women by suggesting their value depends on sexual purity, reflecting a double standard that judges women's sexual behavior more harshly than men's.

frame: Men are supposed to become more valuable and attractive as they age.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises because the frame praises men’s attractiveness with age while devaluing women’s attractiveness in the same context.

frame: Women are supposed to lose their value and attractiveness as they age.
rationale: The problem of unrealistic beauty standards arises because the frame reduces women’s worth solely to their physical appearance and suggests it diminishes with age.
The problem of double standards arises because the frame enforces a gendered disparity by punishing aging in women while rewarding it in men.

frame: Women must uphold high standards of behavior before marriage but are free to abandon them afterward.
rationale: This frame applies different behavior expectations based on marital status, implying that it is acceptable for women to let go of virtues once they secure a husband, reflecting a gendered double standard.

frame: Women are meant to be valued solely for their physical appearance and should not fully cover themselves.
rationale: The problem of appearance-based discrimination arises as this frame demands women be judged solely on how they look, demeaning any other attributes or choices such as clothing.
The problem of double standards arises as the frame enforces unequal rules—urging society to treat women’s attire as inherently ‘unnatural’ while imposing no similar restriction on men.

frame: Cooking is exclusively a woman’s role, and men do not belong in the kitchen.
rationale: The problem of enforced gender norms arises as this frame prescribes cooking as a fixed, gendered duty for women, denying men the same right or ability.
The problem of double standards arises as the frame applies different societal expectations to men and women—accepting women’s presence in the kitchen while mocking men for the same activity.

frame: Men are permitted to cheat without consequences, while women must be punished for the same behavior.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame suggests that men can engage in infidelity with impunity while women are condemned and penalized for identical behavior, reflecting gender-based inequality in moral judgments.

frame: Women's behavior should be strictly controlled and judged by unreasonable standards.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme imposes harsh and inconsistent moral judgments on women’s normal actions, holding them to rules that are not applied to men.

frame: Women who insist on being treated like men should expect the same physical consequences, including being hit.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame implies women claim equality but demand special exemption from violence, highlighting unequal expectations based on gender.
The problem of coercion arises as the frame endorses the use of physical force against women to enforce compliance with patriarchal norms.

frame: Women deserve harsher judgment for their appearance and behavior than men.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame asserts that women should be held to stricter standards than men, reinforcing unequal expectations based on gender.
The problem of appearance-based discrimination arises as the frame legitimizes judging and mocking women solely on their looks and conduct, promoting unfair scrutiny of women’s bodies and choices.

frame: Men should not have to help with cleaning the house.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as this frame applies different expectations to men and women by suggesting that women must handle household tasks while men are exempt, reinforcing unequal gender roles.

frame: Women in the military are only fit for kitchen duty and are incapable of handling serious military roles.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame enforces a gender-based rule that women can only perform domestic tasks within a military context, while men undertake all serious roles.
The problem of undermining women's capabilities arises as the frame dismisses women's skills and potential in combat or leadership positions, suggesting they are inherently unfit for such roles.

frame: A woman’s worth is primarily determined by her sexual behavior, and any change in that behavior deserves attention.
rationale: The problem of double standards is evoked as the meme implies women’s value hinges on their sexual choices, while similar behavior by men is often excused or praised.
This framing reinforces unequal expectations, monitoring and policing women’s sexual autonomy.

frame: Men are meant to be valued for hard work, while women are meant to be valued primarily for their looks.
rationale: The frame invokes a double standard by applying different criteria for valuing men (effort) versus women (appearance).
The frame reduces women’s worth to their looks, ignoring their capabilities and reinforcing a stereotype that appearance is their chief asset.

frame: Women in the past were always respectable and devoted to developing their talents.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame idealizes past women as inherently respectable and talented, implying that modern women fail to meet this selective historical benchmark and are undeserving of respect unless they conform to a narrow ideal.

frame: Women should be judged more harshly for their sexual behavior compared to men.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme suggests it is acceptable to apply harsher moral judgments to women’s sexual behavior than to men’s, reinforcing unequal expectations based solely on gender.

frame: Women in relationships have double standards and use emotional manipulation to avoid accountability, so they deserve to be mocked.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame criticizes women for expecting loyalty and honesty from their partners while not upholding the same standards themselves.
The problem of ridicule arises as the frame asserts that women deserve to be mocked for their perceived hypocrisy and emotional manipulation, belittling them rather than engaging with their concerns.

frame: Men should always have to work hard, whereas women’s effort ought to depend on their appearance.
rationale: The frame enforces a gendered double standard by prescribing different expectations for men and women based on appearance.
It suggests women can escape effort through beauty while men cannot, reinforcing unequal norms for each gender.

frame: Women who do not fit traditional gender norms are invalid as women and deserve to be mocked.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme applies different expectations to women than to men by shaming women for failing to meet feminine norms.

The problem of transphobia arises as the meme invalidates and mocks women who deviate from traditional gender expressions, denying their identity and reinforcing prejudice against gender nonconformity.

frame: Video games are meant to enforce a double standard by portraying male characters as strong and armored while female characters wear impractical, revealing costumes for appearance over protection.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme contrasts the practical armor given to male characters with the impractical, revealing attire forced upon female characters, highlighting unequal treatment based on gender.

frame: Even if women are considered equal to men, they should still be obligated to perform traditional domestic roles.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame enforces that women must fulfill domestic duties—like making a sandwich—despite claiming equality, imposing expectations on women that are not equally applied to men.

frame: Women who dress or behave in a certain way are whores and deserve to be judged and shamed for their sexual behavior and appearance.
rationale: The problem of derogatory labeling arises because the meme uses the term “whore” to demean and insult women based on how they dress or act.
The problem of double standards arises because the meme enforces a harsher moral judgment on women’s sexual behavior—labeling them as ‘whores’—a standard not usually applied to men.

frame: Women must always fulfill their partner’s food and sexual needs to prevent him from cheating.
rationale: This frame enforces a gender norm that places responsibility solely on women to prevent infidelity by satisfying a man’s needs, applying a double standard since men are not held to the same obligation.

frame: Society supports women's body positivity but neglects men's, which is hypocritical.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme highlights that society enthusiastically defends an overweight woman’s body while remaining silent or ridiculing an overweight man’s, illustrating unequal treatment based on gender.

The problem of appearance-based discrimination arises as the meme mocks the lack of support for men’s body positivity, showing that men are judged harshly for their appearance while women are defended.

frame: Men’s loyalty is assumed, while women’s loyalty is doubted.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme upholds a gendered expectation by presenting men as inherently more loyal than women, applying unequal judgments based on gender.

frame: Women are hypocrites: they demand equality but expect chivalrous behavior from men.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme highlights that women apply different rules to themselves—seeking equal rights while expecting traditional chivalrous treatment from men.

The problem of misunderstanding feminism arises as the meme distorts feminist principles by portraying calls for equality as insincere demands for special favors, misrepresenting the movement’s goals.

frame: Women who seek new partners quickly after losing a mate are condemned, while men are allowed to remain single without judgment.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame imposes stricter moral rules on women’s dating behavior than on men’s, implying that women are judged more harshly for the same actions.

frame: Women are hypocritical for demanding perfection in men while hiding their own imperfections with makeup.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the meme mocks women for hiding their own imperfections with makeup while demanding perfection from men, applying different expectations to each gender.

frame: Women who speak out against sexism are hypocritical if they express negative sentiments about men.
rationale: The problem of reverse sexism arises as the frame treats misandrist language (e.g., “Fuck men”) as acceptable while condemning sexism in general, privileging sexist remarks against men over those against women.

The problem of double standards arises as the frame applies different moral criteria to expressions of sexism depending on the target’s gender, labeling women as hypocrites for criticizing sexism when they vent anger toward men.

frame: Women are hypocritical because they idolize other women who are objectified.
rationale: The problem of double standards arises as the frame accuses women of holding inconsistent standards—condemning objectification while participating in or praising the objectification of other women.

frame: Women should be judged more harshly than men for the same behaviors.
rationale: The frame asserts that women deserve harsher criticism than men for identical actions, reinforcing a sexist double standard in judgment.

frame: Women who demand respect are hypocritical because they use sex to get what they want.
rationale: The problem of minimizing feminist efforts arises as the frame dismisses calls for respect and gender equality as mere hypocrisy, thereby trivializing and undermining the goals of the feminist movement.

The problem of double standards arises as the frame applies unequal moral judgments to women by accusing them of hypocrisy for criticizing male dishonesty while allegedly being dishonest themselves through sexual means.
